content: Some exciting updates for crypto enthusiasts and miners. Canaan has finally unveiled the much-anticipated Avalon 1466 Miner, and weâ€™re here to break it down for you.ğŸš€ The Big Reveal ğŸš€ For the past few weeks, thereâ€™s been a buzz on Twitter as Canaan teased us with this new release. Today, we have the full specs, price points, and even the shipping window details. So, letâ€™s dive into what makes this release so special.ğŸ“Š Specifications & Price ğŸ“Š The Canaan Avalon 1466 comes with two models:1.Air Cooled Model (A1466):-Hashrate: 150 terahash-Efficiency: 21.5 joules/terahash-Price: Approximately $2,100Itâ€™s worth noting that its specs align closely with BitMainâ€™s new S19J XP. The real game-changer? The Avalonâ€™s price. At around $2,100, itâ€™s a steal, especially when compared to the S19JXP which is hovering around $5,000.2.Liquid Cooled Model:-Hashrate: 170 terahash-Efficiency: 19.5 joules/terahash-Price: Calculated at 18.88$/terahashWhat stands out here is the price point of the air-cooled model. Itâ€™s tantalizingly low, making it an appealing choice for many.â³ Shipping Window Dilemma â³ But thereâ€™s a catch â€“ the shipping window. The Avalon 1466 wonâ€™t be available for delivery until somewhere between Q1 to Q2 of 2024. Thatâ€™s after the Bitcoin halving, which might be a deal breaker for some.ğŸ“‰ Performance Analysis ğŸ“‰ We tried to ballpark its performance against current BTC prices and market conditions. If we were to have the Avalon 1466 today, based on calculations at a 10-cent kilowatt-hour, its profitability might be around $1.70 per day. However, post-halving, these numbers change drastically.ğŸ” Comparing with Older Models ğŸ” Comparatively, Canaanâ€™s previous flagship, the A1366, isnâ€™t too far behind in specs, suggesting that technological advancements in mining hardware might be plateauing. This could be good news for those who invested in previous models, as their hardware might remain relevant for longer than expected.Comparison TableSpecification/ModelÂ Â Â Antminer S21 (Rumored)Â Â Â Antminer S19 ProÂ Â Â Zeely K-10 Ultra Â Â Â Â Canaan Avalon 1466HashrateÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  200 TH/sÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 110 TH/sÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  200 TH/sÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 150-170 TH/sPower ConsumptionÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  3,000 WattsÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  3,250 WattsÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  4,000 WattsÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  3300 WattsEfficiencyÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  15-19 J/TH Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Â Â 29.5 J/THÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  20 J/THÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 19.5-21.5 J/THCoolingÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Air CoolingÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Air CooledÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Air CooledÂ Â Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Air and Liquid CooledDetailed Comparison:Hashrate:Antminer S21 matches the Zeely K-10 Ultra with a 200 TH/s mining power, nearly double the S19 Pro and significantly higher than the Avalon 1466.Power Consumption:Antminer S21 and Zeely K-10 Ultra both offer superior hashrate, but the S21 is more energy efficient, rumored consuming 1,000 Watts less than the K-10 Ultra. When compared to its predecessor, the S19 Pro, the S21 consumes less power while providing significantly higher hashrate.Efficiency:Antminer S21 sets a new benchmark with a groundbreaking 15-19 J/TH. This is a significant improvement over the S19 Pro and superior to both the Zeely K-10 Ultra and the Avalon 1466.ğŸ”® Future Predictions ğŸ”® While the Avalon 1466â€™s shipping date is a downside, the unveiling gives us a unique foresight into the future of crypto mining. It helps us evaluate the relevance and potential price points of current models. ğŸ“£ Final Thoughts ğŸ“£ While the Canaan Avalon 1466 promises efficiency at a competitive price, the shipping window might be a challenge. Weâ€™re also eager to see how this release affects the prices of older models.Stay tuned, and keep an eye out for updates on the S21 price point, which will give us more clarity on the current mining landscape.Full postCrafting the future, one block at the time!

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: If ASIC manufacturer Canaan has problems with equipment supplies, then ASICs from Bitmain Antminer S21 will sell well, and these ASICs have a very good energy efficiency indicator. Does Canaan have problems producing new chips for these ASICs?

comments.author: TalkativeCoin
comments.body: Quote from: FP91G on September 16, 2023, 05:58:55 PMIf ASIC manufacturer Canaan has problems with equipment supplies, then ASICs from Bitmain Antminer S21 will sell well, and these ASICs have a very good energy efficiency indicator. Does Canaan have problems producing new chips for these ASICs?It's usually supplier issues, but I would say that, most likely, some of their third-party partners are not up to speed.

comments.author: mineshop.eu
comments.body: Quote from: FP91G on September 16, 2023, 05:58:55 PMIf ASIC manufacturer Canaan has problems with equipment supplies, then ASICs from Bitmain Antminer S21 will sell well, and these ASICs have a very good energy efficiency indicator. Does Canaan have problems producing new chips for these ASICs?I belive Bitmain and Canaan has the same chip producer TSMCCan someone confirm that?
